input_feature_name: Curfew login blocker with ASL and GH for Utah minors
input_feature_description: To comply with the Utah Social Media Regulation Act, we are implementing a curfew-based login restriction for users under 18. The system uses ASL to detect minor accounts and routes enforcement through GH to apply only within Utah boundaries. The feature activates during restricted night hours and logs activity using EchoTrace for auditability. This allows parental control to be enacted without user-facing alerts, operating in ShadowMode during initial rollout.
expanded_feature_name: Curfew login blocker with Age-sensitive logic and Geo-handler; a module responsible for routing features based on user region for Utah minors
expanded_feature_description: To comply with the Utah Social Media Regulation Act, we are implementing a curfew-based login restriction for users under 18. The system uses Age-sensitive logic to detect minor accounts and routes enforcement through Geo-handler; a module responsible for routing features based on user region to apply only within Utah boundaries. The feature activates during restricted night hours and logs activity using Log tracing mode to verify compliance routing for auditability. This allows parental control to be enacted without user-facing alerts, operating in Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only during initial rollout.

input_feature_name: PF default toggle with NR enforcement for California teens
input_feature_description: As part of compliance with California's SB976, the app will disable PF by default for users under 18 located in California. This default setting is considered NR to override, unless explicit parental opt-in is provided. Geo-detection is handled via GH, and rollout is monitored with FR logs. The design ensures minimal disruption while meeting the strict personalization requirements imposed by the law.
expanded_feature_name: Personalized feed default toggle with Not recommended enforcement for California teens
expanded_feature_description: As part of compliance with California's SB976, the app will disable Personalized feed by default for users under 18 located in California. This default setting is considered Not recommended to override, unless explicit parental opt-in is provided. Geo-detection is handled via Geo-handler; a module responsible for routing features based on user region, and rollout is monitored with Feature rollout status logs. The design ensures minimal disruption while meeting the strict personalization requirements imposed by the law.

input_feature_name: Child abuse content scanner using T5 and CDS triggers
input_feature_description: In line with the US federal law requiring providers to report child sexual abuse content to NCMEC, this feature scans uploads and flags suspected materials tagged as T5. Once flagged, the CDS auto-generates reports and routes them via secure channel APIs. The logic runs in real-time, supports human validation, and logs detection metadata for internal audits. Regional thresholds are governed by LCP parameters in the backend.
expanded_feature_name: Child abuse content scanner using Tier 5 sensitivity data; more critical than T1-T4 in this internal taxonomy and Compliance Detection System triggers
expanded_feature_description: In line with the US federal law requiring providers to report child sexual abuse content to NCMEC, this feature scans uploads and flags suspected materials tagged as Tier 5 sensitivity data; more critical than T1-T4 in this internal taxonomy. Once flagged, the Compliance Detection System auto-generates reports and routes them via secure channel APIs. The logic runs in real-time, supports human validation, and logs detection metadata for internal audits. Regional thresholds are governed by Local compliance policy parameters in the backend.

input_feature_name: Content visibility lock with NSP for EU DSA
input_feature_description: To meet the transparency expectations of the EU Digital Services Act, we are introducing a visibility lock for flagged user-generated content labeled under NSP. When such content is detected, a soft Softblock is applied and GH ensures enforcement is restricted to the EU region only. EchoTrace supports traceability, and Redline status can be triggered for legal review. This feature enhances accountability and complies with Article 16's removal mechanisms.
expanded_feature_name: Content visibility lock with Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally) for EU DSA
expanded_feature_description: To meet the transparency expectations of the EU Digital Services Act, we are introducing a visibility lock for flagged user-generated content labeled under Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally). When such content is detected, a soft A user-level limitation applied silently without notifications is applied and Geo-handler; a module responsible for routing features based on user region ensures enforcement is restricted to the EU region only. Log tracing mode to verify compliance routing supports traceability, and Flag for legal review (different from its traditional business use for 'financial loss') status can be triggered for legal review. This feature enhances accountability and complies with Article 16's removal mechanisms.

input_feature_name: Jellybean-based parental notifications for Florida regulation
input_feature_description: To support Florida's Online Protections for Minors law, this feature extends the Jellybean parental control framework. Notifications are dispatched to verified parent accounts when a minor attempts to access restricted features. Using IMT, the system checks behavioral anomalies against BB models. If violations are detected, restrictions are applied in ShadowMode with full audit logging through CDS. Glow flags ensure compliance visibility during rollout phases.
expanded_feature_name: Feature name for internal parental control system-based parental notifications for Florida regulation
expanded_feature_description: To support Florida's Online Protections for Minors law, this feature extends the Feature name for internal parental control system parental control framework. Notifications are dispatched to verified parent accounts when a minor attempts to access restricted features. Using Internal monitoring trigger, the system checks behavioral anomalies against Baseline Behavior; standard user behavior used for anomaly detection models. If violations are detected, restrictions are applied in Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only with full audit logging through Compliance Detection System. A compliance-flagging status, internally used to indicate geo-based alerts flags ensure compliance visibility during rollout phases.
